<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Improvise Tool](/Feats.aspx?ID=2131) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 206 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4)

</column>

---

You can jury-rig solutions when you don't have the proper tools on hand. You can attempt to [Repair](/Actions.aspx?ID=42) damaged items without a [repair kit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=43).

 If you have the raw materials available, you can [Craft](/Actions.aspx?ID=43) a basic caltrop set, [candle](/Equipment.aspx?ID=10), [compass](/Equipment.aspx?ID=16), [crowbar](/Equipment.aspx?ID=18), [fishing tackle](/Equipment.aspx?ID=20), [flint and steel](/Equipment.aspx?ID=21), [hammer](/Equipment.aspx?ID=24), [ladder](/Equipment.aspx?ID=28), [piton](/Equipment.aspx?ID=39), [rope](/Equipment.aspx?ID=44), [10-foot pole](/Equipment.aspx?ID=56), [replacement thieves' picks](/Weapons.aspx?ID=34), [long or short tool](/Equipment.aspx?ID=59), or [torch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=60) without consulting a [basic crafter's book](/Equipment.aspx?ID=6).
name: Improvise Tool
